chartbeat.title: NCAAM College Basketball Scores - NCAAM Scoreboard - ESPN

content.description: Real-time NCAAM College Basketball scores on ESPN
content.keywords: NCAAM Scores, NCAAM scoreboard, College Basketball Scores, College Basketball scoreboard

headlines.description: Gary Clark had 14 point and seven rebounds, and No. 11 Cincinnati stayed unbeaten heading into its game against its crosstown rival by beating winless Alabama State 83-51 on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Unbeaten No. 11 Cincinnati beats Alabama State 83-51

headlines.description: Kyle Guy scored 17 points, and No. 18 Virginia held Wisconsin scoreless for more than 7 minutes in the second half in a 49-37 victory Monday night in the Big Ten/ACC Challenge.
headlines.shortLinkText: Guy, Hall lead No. 18 Virginia past Wisconsin, 49-37

headlines.description: Joe Sherburne made four 3-pointers and scored 18 points, Arkel Lamar had 12 points and 12 rebounds, and Maryland, Baltimore County beat Division III Shenandoah 88-59 on Monday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Sherburne hits 4 of UMBC's 13 3-pointers in 88-59 win

headlines.description: Zane Martin hit five 3-pointers and finished with 24 points, both career highs, to help Towson beat Division III St. Mary's (Md.) 90-57 on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Martin hits 5 3s, scores 24 as Towson beats D-III St. Mary's

headlines.description: Tyus Battle scored 13 of his 18 points in the second half, Oshae Brissett and Frank Howard each scored 15 and Syracuse held off Maryland 72-70 in the Big Ten/ACC Challenge on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Syracuse beats Maryland 72-70 to remain unbeaten

video.headline: Cuse holds on for win over Maryland

headlines.description: Chris Silva scored a career-high 26 points and grabbed 10 rebounds to lead South Carolina to a 78-61 win over FIU on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Silva Powers South Carolina to 78-61 Win Over FIU

headlines.description: Matt Morgan had 15 of his 24 points after the break and Cornell, after trailing much of the way, rallied in the second half to beat Duquesne 78-71 on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Morgan scores 24, Cornell beats Duquesne 78-71

headlines.description: Ray Salnave scored 10 of his career-high 18 points in the final five minutes to help Monmouth pull away late in its 81-73 win over previously unbeaten Albany on Monday night and snap a three-game skid.
headlines.shortLinkText: Salnave scores 18 to lead Monmouth past Albany, 81-73

headlines.description: Phillip Carr hauled in 14 rebounds and scored 12 points to help Morgan State beat Mount St. Mary's for the first time since 1982 with a 69-63 win Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Morgan State holds off Mount St. Mary's 69-63

headlines.description: Matt Scott scored 25 points and grabbed 10 rebounds, Marvin Prochet scored 12 and had a career-high 15 rebounds and Niagara beat Army 77-71 on Monday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Scott leads Niagara past Army 77-71 on strength of Scott

headlines.description: Miye Oni scored 16 points, Blake Reynolds added 15 and Yale cruised to a 76-66 win over Delaware on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Yale cruises to 76-66 win over Delaware

headlines.description: Georgie Pacheco-Ortiz had a season-high 17 points and Scottie James had his second-consecutive double-double to help Liberty beat Howard 75-55 on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Pacheco-Ortiz scores 17, leads Liberty past Howard, 75-55

headlines.description: B.J. Stith had 14 points on Monday night and Old Dominion dominated Maryland-Eastern Shore 83-44.
headlines.shortLinkText: Old Dominion dominated Maryland Eastern-Shore 83-44

headlines.description: Kalin Fisher scored a career-high 24 points on 8-of-10 shooting and grabbed a career-best 11 rebounds to help Hampton beat Division II-member St. Leo 72-56 on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Fisher lifts Hampton past D II St. Leo 72-56 behind Fisher

headlines.description: Garrison Mathews sank four 3-pointers and scored 22 points to help lift Lipscomb to a 74-66 win over Belmont on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Lipscomb holds off Belmont 74-66

headlines.description: Sam Hauser hit six 3-pointers and finished with 30 points and four assists -- all career highs -- and Andrew Rowsey scored five of his 15 points in overtime to help Marquette beat Eastern Illinois 86-83 on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hauser hits 6 3s, scores 30; Marquette beats E. Illinois

headlines.description: Mathieu Kamba had 20 points and eight rebounds, Deandre Jones hit a key 3-pointer with 55 seconds left and Central Arkansas beat Morehead State 82-78 on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Central Arkansas holds off Morehead State 82-78

headlines.description: Kimani Jackson and Roddy Peters scored 14 points apiece and combined for 14 rebounds and Nicholls wiped out NAIA-member Blue Mountain College 104-68 on Monday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Nicholls routs NAIA Blue Mountain 104-68

headlines.description: Martez Walker scored a career-high 32 points and Oakland slipped past Oral Roberts for a 93-86 win in overtime Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Oakland slips past Oral Roberts in overtime for 93-86 win

headlines.description: Erick Neal had his second career triple-double on Monday night and graduate transfer Johnny Hamilton had 20 points, 12 rebounds and four blocked shots to help UT Arlington beat Division III UT Dallas 73-53.
headlines.shortLinkText: Neal's triple-double helps UT Arlington top UT Dallas, 73-53

headlines.description: Wesley Person made 5 of 7 from 3-point range and scored 22 to help Troy beat Delaware State 95-64 on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Troy beats Delaware State 95-64

headlines.description: B.J. Glasford scored a career-high 24 points on 11-of-17 shooting and Divine Myles scored 10 points with 11 rebounds to help lead Stetson to an 83-71 win on Monday night against Green Bay.
headlines.shortLinkText: Glasford's career best sends Stetson past Green Bay 83-71

headlines.description: Roosevelt Smart scored 23 points, including 8-for-8 shooting from the line, and North Texas hung on Monday night for an 82-77 win over Grambling.
headlines.shortLinkText: North Texas hangs on for 82-77 win over Grambling

headlines.description: Zjori Bosha scored 18 points on 6-for-9 shooting and Josh Nzeakor had 15 points and 12 rebounds and Lamar's fast start propelled it to a 66-52 win over UTEP on Monday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Lamar hands UTEP 5th straight loss beating Miners 66-52

headlines.description: Matej Kavas scored 24, Jordan Hill added 19 and Seattle survived a slow start to beat Idaho State 73-67 on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Seattle survives Idaho State 73-67

headlines.description: Gibson Johnson hit a career-high 11 free throws and tied his career-best with 19 points, freshman Samuta Avea had 11 of his 13 points the second half and Hawaii held off Division II Adams State for an 87-77 win on Monday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Johnson scores 19, Hawaii holds off D-II Adams State, 87-77

nowFeed.headline: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.
nowFeed.story: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.

nowFeed.headline: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops https://t.co/aMhklA2Vbl
nowFeed.story: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops vimeo.com/256137612

nowFeed.headline: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.
nowFeed.story: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.

nowFeed.headline:
The race for the No. 1 seeds is more wide open now after a few recent upsets. Per BPI, here's where we stand:

Virginia 99%
Villanova 98%
Purdue 71%
Michigan State 52%
Xavier 32%
Duke 29%
North Carolina 9%
Tennessee 4%
Auburn 3%
Kansas 2%

nowFeed.headline: Houston coach Kelvin Sampson said "good teams should win at home," including his Cougars, who are 13-0 this season at home, including Thursday's 67-62 upset of No. 5 Cincinnati.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.

nowFeed.headline: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.
nowFeed.story: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.

nowFeed.headline: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.
nowFeed.story: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
